prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Buchanan County (Va.) Miscellaneous Records, 1885-1946. Local government records collection, Buchanan County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Buchanan County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Buchanan County was named for the United States president James Buchanan and was formed from Tazewell and Russell Counties in 1858.

Estrays were stray livestock found wandering. An inquest was held to determine the value of the livestock in order to reimburse the person who had found and cared for the animal. The report generally includes a physical description of the animal as well as an assessed monetary value.

Liens are a claim, encumbrance, or charge on property for payment of some debt, obligation, or duty. Lien dockets list the nature and amount of the lien and the services or materials taken from the debtors to pay their debts; or to discharge their obligation or duty
Records were destroyed by fire in 1885; records created after that date suffered extreme damage in a flood in 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Buchanan County (Va.) Miscellaneous Records, 1885-1946, consist of County and Circuit Court Appraisements of Estrays; County Court Judgment Lien Docket, Volume 1 and Volume 2; Mechanics' Liens; Register of Persons Practicing Optomety; Miscellaneous Contracts (including one adoption, 1946, which is restricted for 75 years); Contracts for Personal Property; and Federal Crop Morgage Book.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Buchanan County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"
